summary: This document is a Bureau of Prisons disciplinary record for Jeffrey Epstein following an incident on July 23, 2019, where he was charged with tattooing or self-mutilation. It includes a referral to a Discipline Hearing Officer (DHO), a notice of inmate rights, and a psychological evaluation determining Epstein was competent to proceed with the disciplinary process. This document is a Federal Bureau of Prisons incident report and related staff memoranda detailing a possible suicide attempt by inmate Jeffrey Epstein on July 23, 2019, at the Metropolitan Correctional Center in New York. It includes descriptions of the incident, medical assessments, inmate statements, and photographs. Epstein and his cellmate provide conflicting accounts of the event. This document is a series of Bureau of Prisons (BOP) inmate management system screenshots for Jeffrey Epstein, dated July 30, 2019. It includes his profile, disciplinary record showing a pending charge for tattooing or self-mutilation, and sentence monitoring data while he was held at the Metropolitan Correctional Center in New York.

persons.name: Jeffrey Edward Epstein
persons.context: The subject of all BOP inmate records in this document, identified by register number 176318-054, held at the New York Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) on charges of sex trafficking conspiracy and sex trafficking of minors.

persons.name: Dr. M.
persons.context: Conducted a Suicide Risk Assessment on Epstein on July 9, 2019, noting Epstein denied any history of mental health treatment or suicidal ideation.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The inmate at the center of the incident report for an alleged suicide attempt/self-mutilation. He is found with a homemade rope around his neck and later makes allegations against his cellmate.

persons.name: Nicholas
persons.context: Epstein's cellmate (Register #78514-054). He is the one who initially alerts staff and provides a statement that he found Epstein with a string around his neck. Epstein later accuses him of harassment and attempted extortion.

persons.name: M. Thomas
persons.context: BOP staff member who authored a memorandum detailing his response to the incident and assistance in moving Epstein.

persons.name: M. MLP
persons.context: Mid-Level Practitioner who examined Epstein after the incident, noting erythema on his neck and knee, and documenting his clinical encounter.

connections.description: Dr. M. conducted a Suicide Risk Assessment on inmate Epstein on July 9, 2019, as referenced in the psychological evaluation.
Were housed together in cell Z05-124. Epstein later accused Nicholas of attempted extortion, threats, and harassment over the preceding week.
MLP conducted a medical assessment of Epstein following the incident, documenting his injuries and his uncooperative attitude regarding the events.

events.title: Epstein charged with self-mutilation
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein was charged with code 228 (Tattooing or Self-Mutilation) at the Metropolitan Correctional Center, New York, leading to incident report number 3282555.

events.title: Suicide Risk Assessment by Dr. M.
events.description: Dr. M. conducted a Suicide Risk Assessment on inmate Epstein, who denied any history of mental health treatment, suicidal ideation, or self-injurious behavior.

events.title: Psychological evaluation for disciplinary competency
events.description: A psychological evaluation was completed, determining Epstein was competent to proceed with the disciplinary process regarding the self-mutilation charge.

events.title: Epstein's Possible Suicide Attempt
events.description: At approximately 1:27 AM, Jeffrey Epstein is found in his SHU cell with an orange homemade rope around his neck, appearing unresponsive. Staff intervene, remove the rope, and transport him to medical observation. Conflicting narratives emerge from Epstein and his cellmate about the cause.

events.title: Epstein's Allegations Against Cellmate
events.description: After becoming responsive, Epstein tells staff his cellmate, Nicholas, tried to kill him and had been extorting him for money with threats of violence over the past week. He claims he only told his attorney, not staff.

events.title: Medical Assessment
events.description: MLP M. MLP examines Epstein, finding a circular line of erythema on his neck and a small mark on his knee. Epstein is uncooperative, stating he does not know what happened and does not want to discuss it.

events.title: Disciplinary Investigation
events.description: A lieutenant conducts an investigation of the incident report, advises Epstein of his rights, and concludes the report is accurate and the charge of self-mutilation is warranted.

events.title: Epstein Disciplinary Report for Tattooing/Self-Mutilation
events.description: A pending disciplinary report was filed against Jeffrey Epstein for the offense of 'Tattooing or Self-Mutilation,' referred to a Discipline Hearing Officer (DHO) based on the severity of the offense.

events.title: Epstein Admission to NY MCC
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein was admitted to the New York Metropolitan Correctional Center as a pre-sentencing inmate from the adult court of the US Marshals for the Southern District of New York.

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center, New York, New York
Metropolitan Correctional Center, 150 Park Row, New York, New York 10007
Special Housing Unit (SHU), M-Tier, Cell Z05-124
NYM-NEW YORK MCC (Metropolitan Correctional Center, New York)
USM SOUTHERN DISTRICT (United States Marshals Service, Southern District of New York)
USM NYS 54N NEW YORK, NY (United States Marshals, New York)
keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein was charged with 'Tattooing or Self-Mutilation' (code 228) on July 23, 2019, while incarcerated at the Metropolitan Correctional Center in New York.
A psychological evaluation on July 30, 2019, determined Epstein was competent to proceed with the disciplinary process for this charge.
A prior Suicide Risk Assessment on July 9, 2019, by Dr. M. noted Epstein denied any history of mental health treatment, suicidal ideation, or self-injurious behavior.
The document includes formal Bureau of Prisons procedures, including a DHO referral checklist and a notice of inmate rights for a disciplinary hearing.
The psychological report references an unclear event where 'it is unclear at this time If he had placed the string around his neck or if someone else did.'
Jeffrey Epstein was found in his MCC cell on July 23, 2019, at 1:27 AM with a homemade orange rope around his neck, in an incident classified as a possible suicide attempt/self-mutilation.
Epstein later accused his cellmate, Nicholas, of attempting to kill him and of a week-long campaign of extortion and threats, which he claimed he had only reported to his attorney.
The cellmate, Nicholas, stated he was asleep, felt something hit his legs, turned on the light, and saw Epstein with a string around his neck before alerting guards.
Medical assessment revealed a circular line of erythema (redness) on Epstein's neck consistent with a ligature mark, but Epstein was uncooperative and claimed not to know how it happened.
Multiple Bureau of Prisons staff members filed memoranda documenting their response to the incident, creating a detailed but conflicting record of the events.
On July 30, 2019, Jeffrey Epstein had a pending disciplinary charge for 'Tattooing or Self-Mutilation' at the Metropolitan Correctional Center in New York.
Epstein's BOP inmate profile lists his charges as 'SEX TRAFFICKING CONSP.' and 'SEX TRAFFICKING OF MINORS.'
Epstein was admitted to the MCC on July 8, 2019, and was housed in Unit 5N, House 4, Range B, Bed 206LAD.
The records show no existing chronological disciplinary entries or executable sanctions for Epstein as of the query date of July 30, 2019, aside from the pending tattooing/self-mutilation incident.
The document confirms Epstein was in federal custody at the MCC in New York approximately two weeks prior to his death on August 10, 2019.
